com.appboy.events
Class EventManager

java.lang.Object
  com.appboy.events.EventManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEventPublisher
public final class EventManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEventPublisher

Provides a thread-safe in-application publish/subscribe mechanism to propagate events throughout the application. Event types are represented by the type of the message that is sent. For example, a subscription to the type String requires that the subscriber knows how to handle message payloads passed to it that are of the type String. By implementing the EventManager in this way, any type (including pre-existing types or those in other libraries) can be an event type and message payload. TODO(billmag) - This isn't currently thread safe for concurrent calls to both add and remove on the same keys. Multiple add calls or multiple remove calls are both supported, but mixing them together is non-deterministic. TODO(billmag) - If this sees heavier use, consider implementing a 1 thread per background subscriber subscription type (currently all subscribers for a particular event are executed on the same thread).

Method Detail

subscribeOnUIThread

public <T> boolean subscribeOnUIThread(android.app.Activity activity,
                                       IEventSubscriber<T> subscriber,
                                       java.lang.Class<T> eventClass)
Subscribes the specified subscriber to the specified event class. The EventManager guarantees that when the specified event class is published to this subscriber, the resulting trigger() call will be executed on the main/UI thread, regardless of the origin of the publish call. To avoid duplicate subscriptions, calls with the same subscriber, event class and thread policy of an existing subscription will be ignored.

Type Parameters:
T - - The type of the subscriber and the event class.
Parameters:
activity - - The Activity who's UI thread will be published to when events are published.
subscriber - - The subscriber to be added.
eventClass - - A Class object representing the type of events to subscribe to.
Returns:
- true if the specified subscriber was not already a subscriber, else false.

subscribeWithTriggerInBackground

public <T> boolean subscribeWithTriggerInBackground(IEventSubscriber<T> subscriber,
                                                    java.lang.Class<T> eventClass)
Subscribes the specified subscriber to the specified event class. The EventManager guarantees that when the specified event class is published to this subscriber, the resulting trigger() calls will be executed in original subscriber order on a newly created background thread, regardless of the origin of the publish call. To avoid duplicate subscriptions, calls with the same subscriber, event class and thread policy of an existing subscription will be ignored.

Type Parameters:
T - - The type of the subscriber and the event class.
Parameters:
subscriber - - The subscriber to be added.
eventClass - - A Class object representing the type of events to subscribe to.
Returns:
- true if the specified subscriber was not already a subscriber, else false.

subscribeWithSynchronousTrigger

public <T> boolean subscribeWithSynchronousTrigger(IEventSubscriber<T> subscriber,
                                                   java.lang.Class<T> eventClass)
Subscribes the specified subscriber to the specified event class. The EventManager guarantees that when the specified event class is published to this subscriber, the resulting trigger() call will be executed synchronously on the same thread that the publish() call was made. To avoid duplicate subscriptions, calls with the same subscriber, event class and thread policy of an existing subscription will be ignored. Caution: Publish() calls made from the main/UI thread will still execute subscribers of this type synchronously, so don't put long running operations on it.

Type Parameters:
T - - The type of the subscriber and the event class.
Parameters:
subscriber - - The subscriber to be added.
eventClass - - A Class object representing the type of events to subscribe to.
Returns:
- true if the specified subscriber was not already a subscriber, else false.

removeBackgroundSubscription

public <T> boolean removeBackgroundSubscription(IEventSubscriber<T> subscriber,
                                                java.lang.Class<T> eventClass)
Removes the specified subscription from the background subscribers list for the specified event, if it exists.

Type Parameters:

Parameters:
subscriber - - The subscriber to be removed.
eventClass - - A Class object representing the type of events to subscribe to.
Returns:
true if the background subscription list for the specified event contained the specified subscriber.

removeUISubscription

public <T> boolean removeUISubscription(android.app.Activity activity,
                                        IEventSubscriber<T> subscriber,
                                        java.lang.Class<T> eventClass)
Removes the specified subscription from the UI subscribers list for the specified activity and event, if it exists.

Type Parameters:
T - - The type of the subscriber and the event class.
Parameters:
activity - - The Activity that subscribed to the event.
subscriber - - The subscriber to be removed.
eventClass - - A Class object representing the type of events to subscribe to.
Returns:
true if the subscription list for activity contained the specified subscriber for the specified event.

removeUISubscriptionsForActivity

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArraySet<IEventSubscriber>> removeUISubscriptionsForActivity(android.app.Activity activity)
Removes all subscriptions meant to run on the UI thread for the specified Activity.

Parameters:
activity - - The Activity to remove all UI subscriptions for.
Returns:
the subscriptions previously attached to the specified activity, or null if no subscriptions existed.

publish

public <T> void publish(T message,
                        java.lang.Class<T> eventClass)
Publishes the specified message to all subscribers of the specified event class. Note that it is valid for the message to be a subclass of the specified event class, however, events will only trigger on subscribers who have explicitly subscribed to eventClass. Subscribers are triggered in the following order: * All main/UI thread subscribers will have their trigger() call scheduled on the main/UI thread in the same order that they originally subscribed. * A new Runnable will be executed by the injected Executor that will synchronously trigger all background thread subscribers in the same order that they originally subscribed. * All synchronous subscribers will have trigger() called synchronously on the same thread as the publish() caller in the same order that they originally subscribed. No guarantees are made with respect to completion time for main/UI or background thread subscribers. However, trigger() calls for all synchronous subscribers are guaranteed to complete before this call returns.

Specified by:
publish in interface IEventPublisher
Type Parameters:
T - - The type of the event and message class.
Parameters:
message - - An object to pass to all subscribers of the specified event. This object should provide enough information to subscribers that they are able to perform their desired operations.
eventClass - - A Class object representing the type of events to subscribe to.
